body:
Feature gate: `#![feature(is_some_and)]`

This is a tracking issue for `Option::is_some_and`, `Result::is_ok_and` and `Result::is_err_and`.

### Public API

<!--
For most library features, it'd be useful to include a summarized version of the public API.
(E.g. just the public function signatures without their doc comments or implementation.)
-->

```rust
impl<T> Option<T> {
    pub fn is_some_and(self, f: impl FnOnce(T) -> bool) -> bool;
}

impl<T, E> Result<T, E> {
    pub fn is_ok_and(self, f: impl FnOnce(T) -> bool) -> bool;
    pub fn is_err_and(self, f: impl FnOnce(E) -> bool) -> bool;
}
```

### Steps / History

- [x] Lots of discussion and bikeshedding starting here: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/62358#issuecomment-970280621
- [x] Implementation: #93051
- [x] Rename: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/94765
- [x] Take `self` by value: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/98354
- [x] Final comment period (FCP)
- [x] Stabilization PR: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/110019

### Unresolved Questions

- [x] Naming. Alternatives:
   - `is_some_with` / `is_ok_with` / `is_err_with`
   - :arrow_right: `is_some_and` / `is_ok_and` / `is_err_and`
     - See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/93050#issuecomment-1016407980 and https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/93050#issuecomment-1019312470
   - `contains` / `contains_err`
   - `and_is` / `and_err_is`
   - `is`
   - `has`
- [x] Take `self` or `&self`?
